questions.question_text: An IS auditor conducts a review of a third-party vendor's reporting of key performance indicators (KPIs). Which of the following findings should be of MOST concern to the auditor?

choices.D: KPI data is not being analyzed.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
If KPI data is not being analyzed, it means the organization is not using these valuable insights to assess their operational efficiency, client satisfaction, and overall business performance.

Selected Answer: B
The finding that should be of most concern to the auditor is when KPIs are not clearly defined. Clear and well-defined Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) are crucial for assessing and measuring the performance of a third-party vendor. If the KPIs are not clearly defined, it can lead to ambiguity, misunderstanding, and misinterpretation of the performance data, making it difficult to make informed decisions or evaluations.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is critical to the successful establishment of an enterprise IT architecture?

choices.D: An architecture encompassing only critical systems
choices.A: Comparison of the architecture with that of other organizations

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Organizational support for standardization is critical to the successful establishment of an enterprise IT architecture. Standardization helps ensure consistency, interoperability, and efficiency across the organization's IT systems and processes. When there is strong support for standardization from the organization, it becomes easier to implement and maintain an IT architecture that aligns with best practices, industry standards, and the organization's strategic goals.
While the other options may have relevance, organizational support for standardization is fundamental to achieving a cohesive and effective enterprise IT architecture.

questions.question_text: Which of the following would be of GREATEST concern to an IS auditor when evaluating governance processes for a user-developed tool?

choices.C: Evaluate the types of databases being used.
choices.A: Determine which databases will be in scope.
choices.B: Identify the most critical database controls.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Setting scope is very important. After deciding on the scope, you need to find the important databases within the scope. Databases outside the scope are not important.

Selected Answer: C
Understanding the types of databases being used within the organization provides essential context for planning the review. This includes identifying the databases' platforms, vendors, versions, and configurations. Such information is crucial for determining the scope of the review (Option A), as it helps the auditor understand the potential risks and vulnerabilities associated with each type of database.

Selected Answer: A
A for me
